title: Firefox menus vanish when the mouse moves onto them
content:
When I click on a Firefox menu (File, Edit, View, etc.) or the hamburger menu, or a drop-down menu on a web page, the menu appears. Then, when I move the mouse to hover over the menu, the menu vanishes. If, instead, I hold down the mouse button, I can move over the menu without it disappearing.

I'm using a focus-follows-mouse window manager (VTWM) and I think, somehow, Firefox is getting a focus change message when the mouse moves onto the menu. I think this because of the way the Firefox titlebar flickers from showing it's the active window to the inactive window, then active again, once the menu disappears.

Please advise.

Thanks, Richard
creator: rellwood

title: Cross Site Tracking Cookies
content:
Why do Cross Site tracking cookies show up after I shut down the browser and restart? I have my history set up to delete everything when I close the browser so I'm curious why cross site cookies are apparently allowed to exist/function, even after a restart?

Dano
creator: danohall

title: Facebook their auto refresh annoyance
content:
Can anyone help me out and others on this matter? several months ago appears FB decided to screw everyone over by arbitrarily forcing auto refresh. If you're reading something long and or have to step away for a moment it is gone.

Some have posted for chrome they have an extension that stopped it. The only one on FF does not work. I tried it, does nothing at all. Time for FF to fix this issues allowing you to turn it on or off at my will.

Thanks Mike
creator: mikedeplanche

title: Pocket blank place holder how to remove
content: I removed a Pocket link now I have a Blank Place Holder I would like to know how to remove the Blank Place Holder ? I am not subscribed to Pocket at least I do not think I am
creator: dwightrph

title: Strange new requester appeared
content: A strange new requester appeared in Firefox today. I do not think that I clicked on anything without noticing. I was just watching a Youtube video and the requester appeared when I was moving the cursor down across the screen. The requester items would not respond, and the requester could not be closed. I had to quit Firefox and restart to get rid of it. See attached screen capture.
creator: kurtfaasse

title: Back To Top for Firefox (WE) replacement
content:
I love this addon, but sometimes it doesn't respond. it hasn't been updated since 2017 and the support page is inaccessible.

Back To Top for Firefox (WE)

Is there a something similar available?
creator: noel_envoide

title: Seeking: Add-on to post to Facebook
content: I cannot find any add-on which allows the user to post a web page or blog post to Facebook. I know there are share products like Buffer which post to multiple social media accts. But I'm seeking an add-on that only posts to Facebook.
creator: richards1052

title: Media not playing
content:
Hey all, videos stopped working a few weeks ago and I'm not sure why. It seems to be an issue across all websites, from Youtube to Twitter to Tiktok and beyond. The videos will begin to load, but almost immediately will freeze up and won't load/play any further. Oh and I've also noticed that Soundcloud (via NTS.live) isn't working for me either.

What could be causing this issue?
creator: quinnthereaux

title: Since Thunderbird 115.6.1 was installed files disappear when I move them to an Archive or Draft folder.  How can I fix this and how can I recover those files from the server?
content: Since Thunderbird 115.6.1 was installed files disappear when I move them to an Archive or Draft folder. How can I fix this and how can I recover those files from the server?
creator: RichJan

title: opening links in emails
content: I use to be able to click a link in an email and it would open the link. Now it has a popup that says you are keeping me safe and I have to say it is not spam and it will open. I want it to open automatically when I click on the link instead of having to open it in a new tab.
creator: sog22

title: XHR requests on the network tab of the DevTools don't show stack trace
content:
I am doing XHR post requests from javascript.

The requests entries don't show the stack trace tab. Am I missing some configuration?

https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/network_monitor/request_details/index.html#network-monitor-request-details-stack-trace-tab
creator: hey+firefox.com

title: ERRO FIREFOX E CERTIFICADO DIGITAL
content: Estou há dias tentando acessar contas gov.br principalmente https://servicos.dpf.gov.br/gesp/ com uso de certificado digital e apos ler o certificado apresenta erro
creator: glaucianeleite

title: Edit and resend ignores cookie header
content:
I am trying to resend network requests from the DevTools in order to debug during development.

The request method is POST, I tried all available SameSite + Secure cookie configuration combinations, nothing helps.

When resending the request, the Cookie-Header is ignored.

I also tried to use the 'old' Edit and Resend interface, by configuring a variable on about:config.
creator: hey+firefox.com

title: Crash on every tab
content:
Hi

My firefox suddenly stops working, it crashes on every tab I open.

I tried the troubleshoot mode (safe mode), tried refreshing firefox, tried uninstalling and reinstalling, tried cleaning the firefox folder and registry manually and then restart, ... everything that I could find on web, it just keeps crashing.

In "about:crashes" tab, it shows nothing, so I dont know what I can provide for diagnosis.

Please advise, thanks.
creator: leonlx126

title: download file location setting
content: When I change the file download location using the Browse button, the location shows the change but if I quit Firefox and next time I try to downlaod a file the location reverts back to the original location. Please help. Thank you.
creator: wa0bkp

title: Window-M shortcut doesn't work for Firefox
content: I make frequent use of the Windows system-level keyboard shortcut Windows Logo button + M to go directly to the Windows desktop. Firefox does not respond to this keyboard shortcut by minimizing. How can I fix this? I already tried refreshing Firefox. This is a big enough issue to get me to abandon the browser, since I depend on keyboard shortcuts.
creator: rmstorey

title: I select full screen the game stays the same size but at the top of the screen the bottom half is black
content: I play diggy's adventure when I select full screen the game stays the same size but at the top of the screen the bottom half is black, I tried on a different browser and it works ok.

title: Firefox Home Page no longer displays shortcuts I had
content:
I have Firefox set to open on the default home page with 2 rows of shortcuts. After an update yesterday, all my shortcuts disappeared on my work computer. They are still there on my laptop however. I tried to sync, no go. I have tried to re-add the shortcuts manually and it won't save it. It is important that I fix this as I have several tabs open and signed it to different websites that I work with and this saved me a lot of time.

Help!
creator: dpaunache

content: Every time I open multiple tabs, which is common, the last one opened is the one after the current tab. Is there a way to get them to open chronologically? This is Android Mobile.

title: 书签同步问题

title: Dragging a link to a new tab (i.e. Youtube) does not preserve autoplay blocking settings.
content:
As said in title. I like to drag links/youtube videos to new tabs instead of right clicking/middle click. The problem with this is that these tabs autoplay after a short amount of time without me switching to them, whereas right click/middle click do not (since I have autoplay on unfocused tabs blocked). This problem persists in troubleshoot mode.

I have tried the site-specific autoplay permissions, but I still want to keep the 'switching focus to new tab autoplays content', and I do not want to have to press play if I use firefox's site-specific blocked autoplay.
creator: kickdubb

title: Sound Quality
content: Hello, I recently switched from the Edge browser to Mozilla and encountered a problem. The sound quality in the Mozilla browser is worse than in Edge, regardless of the site, whether it’s watching a movie, a video on YouTube, or just listening to music. I tried a completely new profile, without my settings, without extensions, and everything else, the problem did not disappear. It feels like the browser’s audio codec just compresses the sound quality. I will attach 2 documents: Application Information and Raw Data I will also leave a link to a short video clip where I compared the sound quality between Edge and Firefox in the browser version of Deezer, as an example, so you better understand what I’m talking about. Google Drive Link
creator: darkwarhammerbykhorus

title: multiple background processes created when live streaming
content:
Hello Mozilla Support,

Since 2 upgrades ago, anytime I try to watch a livestream, my browser slows right down and then crashes.

I don't care why its happening, I just want a definitive fix for the issue.

I'm so aggrieved at this happening constantly, if you cannot provide a firm resolution to this issue, i will simply move to another browser.

I've tried your about:config setting restart to false and other fixes but still keeps happening.

I await your reply.

With Regards,

Mark
creator: marincor

title: Elveszett a böngészői adataim
content: Szép napot! Már mint megpróbáltam hogy visszaszerezem az elveszett dolgaimat de amikor bejelentkezek az eddig használt felhasználomal nem akarja rendesen szinkronizálni és totál elveszett az összes jelszavam és a könyvjelzőböl is minden.

Websites like Netflix and websites banks ask for an update of FF,although I have the latest, 121.0.1 Netflix doesn't allow me to enter the website (see screendump) The ASN-bank asks for an update but I can work around it (see screendump) Screendumps are in Dutch, they text is about asking for an update.

Can you help me out to fix this?

Thanks in advance. Frans

content:
Hi,

Using FF 121.0.1 on a Windows 10 PC

For info, I can use PayPal without any issue on other browsers including Chrome and Brave.

title: Firefox seems to Limit Speeds to 300Mb/s when using any other website besides speedtest.net

title: caricamento web site dopo accesso
content: il sito in question è: https://www.nike.com. Dopo aver inserito i dati di autentificazione (ID e password) il sito mi chiede di inserire un codice che mi viene inviato per email. Dopo aver inserito questo codice la pagina rimane bianca. Il problema si verifica solo in uno specifico PC, che si usi firefox, google chrome, etc.
creator: albertoagosti

title: Compatibility Issue Between Firefox and Intel Evo Laptop – Need Help!
content:
Hey Mozilla Support Community,

I hope you're all doing well. I'm reaching out because I've encountered a bit of a head-scratcher and was wondering if anyone else has experienced something similar.

I recently got myself an Intel Evo laptop, and while Chrome seems to be working seamlessly, I'm facing compatibility issues with Firefox. It's a bit puzzling, and I'm hoping to get some guidance from this knowledgeable community.

Here are the details of the issue:

Problem: I'm experiencing compatibility issues between Firefox and my Intel Evo laptop. The browser doesn't seem to be performing as smoothly as expected. Oddly, Chrome is working perfectly fine.

Symptoms:

Laggy performance when navigating websites. Occasional freezes and delays. General sluggishness compared to Chrome. What I've Tried: I've already tried a few troubleshooting steps:

Cleared the cache and cookies. Disabled unnecessary add-ons and extensions. Updated Firefox to the latest version. Checked for system updates on my Intel Evo laptop. System Information:


Firefox Version: 50 Operating System: window 10 I'm turning to this community in the hopes that someone might have encountered a similar issue or has insights into resolving compatibility concerns between Firefox and Intel Evo laptops. If you have any tips, suggestions, or if you've successfully addressed a similar problem, please share your knowledge!

Your help is much appreciated. Thanks in advance for your assistance!
creator: susanconner232

title: Firefox and Thunderbird installed, but not in usual place
content:
I have restored my Windows 10 Home (64), deleting all previous installed apps during the process. Hereafter Firefox and Thunderbird are downloaded and installed.

I did not find the 2 Apps in the usual program folder, and they do not appear in START->ALL APPS.

Searching my computer, I found Firefox and Thunderbird in these locations: Firefox: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Mozilla.Firefox_121.0.1.0_x64__n80bbvh6b1yt2\VFS\ProgramFiles\Firefox Package Root Thunderbird: "C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\MozillaThunderbird.MZLA_115.6.0.0_x64__h5892qc0xkpca\VFS\ProgramFiles\MZLA Package Root\thunderbird.exe"

My question: is this the usual place or have I mixed things up during installation ?
creator: erlingagesen

title: Video playback freezing randomly and audio continues to play
content: The title describes the problem I'm facing. I don't really use other sites that have videos other than Youtube. But I notice that the videos freeze quite often and audio just continues to play. The videos then unfreeze and skip multiple frames. I've noticed clearing browser cache seems to help but it doesn't help for longer than a 2 min video at best. At worst, it doesn't affect it at all.

title: Is it safe to save credit cards in Firefox on Linux?
content: Just recently I realized that the master password does not apply to credit card information. Firefox on Mac and Windows, if a login password exists, allows us to require authentication to autofill, view or edit saved credit cards. Firefox on Linux doesn't allow this authentication. So, I'm guessing that the credit card information is stored in Linux in an insecure manner. This is true? Another question about Mac and Windows. Does requiring authentication for credit card processes mean that the card information is encrypted on disk? Or does the password only protect information from unauthorized viewing, and the cards are stored on disks in text form?

title: iCloud Passwords not showing up in Autofill in Firefox.
content: On my phone, both passwords from Firefox and iCloud auto fill into my browser, but on Mac I do not see anything besides the Firefox ones. I keep my most up-to-date passwords in iCloud, but would love to use auto fill in Firefox as I am not a fan of Safari. Is there a way to set this up?
